dir-section.heading: Education
dir-section.p: Education is available free of charge at all levels, and is officially compulsory for all children between the ages of six and 15 years. Primary education begins at the age of six and lasts for six years. In 2019/20 pre-primary enrolment was equivalent to 93.3% of children in the relevant age-group. In 2020/21 primary enrolment included 97.4% of children in the relevant age-group. Secondary education, beginning at the age of 12, is generally for six years, divided into two equal cycles. In 2020/21 enrolment in lower secondary schools included 98.4% of children in the relevant age-group. Total enrolment in upper secondary school included 94.0% of the students in the relevant age-group. The vernacular language (demotiki) has replaced the formal version (katharevoussa) in secondary education. In 2021 expenditure on education represented around 7.1% of total government expenditure.
